word_mean: 毫克：千分之一(10－3)克，符号为mg

sentence.Network_en: Zemel says that when calcium levels are low, the body releases a hormone that helps squeeze the most out of every available milligram of the mineral.
sentence.Network_cn: 泽莫尔博士说,当人体中的钙含量偏低时, 身体里就会产生一种荷尔蒙,它能帮助肌体最大限度地吸收所摄入的钙.

sentence.Network_en: One milligram of ricin can kill an adult.
sentence.Network_cn: 一毫克蓖麻毒可使一个成年人死亡.

sentence.Network_en: Soon after, the first off - world teleportation moved a milligram of iron to Mars.
sentence.Network_cn: 很快, 第一次将一毫克的铁传送到了远离地球的火星.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 一毫克（milligram），或者千分之一克的物质是肉眼容易看得见的，一滴水的重量大约有 50 毫克．再往下是微克（microgram)，或 …

entry.def: A milligram is a unit of weight that is equal to a thousandth of a gramme.

auth_sentence.content: I reckon a good audiologist could determine the proper milligram.
auth_sentence.res_content: I reckon a good audiologist could determine the proper milligram.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I reckon a good audiologist could determine the proper milligram.

auth_sentence.content: In a giraffe that weighs a third of a ton, the combined "waste" that you are fretting over wouldn't measure a milligram.
